title: Super Simple FSM
description: Hierarchical finite state machine (FSM) based on gameplay tags with replication support.
longDescription:
Powerful state machine system with many features


Create state machines within a single blueprint component.

  • Also supports creating the state machine in a single C++ class instead.
  • Both blueprint and C++ examples provided.


Replication support

  • Activate optional replication on the component, and all clients will sync their state with the server.


Gameplay tags to represent state.

  • Supports deeply nested hierarchy of states. Easily add new states without modifying code.


Assign your own Enter/Exit/Update functions per state

  • this keeps your gameplay logic neatly organized


Perform transitions to exit and enter states easily using a single function call

  • Eg Transitioning from Seasons.Winter.Snowy to Seasons.Spring will automatically call the
  • Exit function of Seasons.Winter.Snowy
  • Exit function of Seasons.Winter
  • Enter function of Seasons.Spring


Highly optimized

  • Entire FSM component does not tick if no active states have a registered tick function. It will automatically begin ticking when you enter a state that requires a tick, and turn itself off afterwards.
  • Only uses a single replicated gameplaytag variable to represent the entire hierarchy of active states in the FSM.


Easy debugging

  • Active state and registered enter/exit/update functions are visible in the details panel of the component


Documentation:

https://www.respawnpoint.net/supersimplefsm/readme.txt
